title: Slides
text:
Basic navigation
Basic navigation is done using the following keyboard shortcuts:







Action
Keys




Next slide
‚Üí or SPACE or N


Previous slide
‚Üê or P


Navigate without fragments
Alt ‚Üí Alt ‚Üê


Jump to first/last slide
Shift ‚Üí Shift ‚Üê


Overview of all slides
Esc

title: Slides
text:
Navigation Menu

You can access the navigation menu using the button located in the bottom left corner of the presentation.
Clicking the button opens a slide navigation menu that enables you to easily jump to any slide:

title: Slides
text:
Save presention as PDF

Access the navigation menu using the button located in the bottom left corner of the presentation.
The navigation menu also includes a Tools pane that provides access to the various other navigation tools including Print to PDF.
It is recommended to use Google Chrome if you want to print the slides as PDF

title: Slides
text:
Print presentation

Simply follow the steps described in ‚ÄúSave presention as PDF‚Äù and print the PDF.



Jan Kirenz

title: Notebook
text:
Load Python libaries and API keys.

import os
import openai
import pandas as pd
import altair as alt
from dotenv import load_dotenv, find_dotenv


_ = load_dotenv(find_dotenv()) # read local .env file
openai.api_key  = os.environ['OPENAI_API_KEY']

title: Notebook
text:
Load Python libaries and API keys.

import os
import openai
import pandas as pd
import altair as alt
from dotenv import load_dotenv, find_dotenv


_ = load_dotenv(find_dotenv()) # read local .env file
openai.api_key  = os.environ['OPENAI_API_KEY']

title: Requirements
text:
To start this lab, you‚Äôll need the following environments:

SQL: MySQL, MySQL Workbench and a database called db_data
Python: Anaconda, Anaconda Environment lab and Visual Studio Code
Working environment: A folder on your machine called competitive and an environment file with your MySQL password







Important



Visit the ‚ÄúProgramming Toolkit-webpage‚Äù to learn how to set up the environments.

title: Welcome üëã
text:
Lab ‚ÄúName‚Äù
In this lab you will ‚Ä¶






Important



Make sure you meet all the requirements and have read the lecture slides before you start with the assignments


What you will learn in this lab:

How to set up a MySQL database
Use SQL for data analysis
Make use of Pandas for data analysis in Python
Use Altair for data visualization in Python

title: Workflow
text:
This is a Quarto slidedeck.

Create new labs GitHub-Repo
Create new branch gh-pages
Change settings in page: gh-pages and root
Open VS Code
Change Quarto seetings in files
Render all in terminal: quarto render
Push to GitHub
